title-group.article-title: Automated Procedures for the Improvement of a Machine Translation System by Feedback from Postediting

abstract.p: In recent years, machine translation has enjoyed limited practical use with the aid of postediting. This paper proposes that feedback of a posteditor's corrections to a machine translation system can improve the translation system. We discuss some concrete approaches to the implementation of such a feedback mechanism. Our experimental system analyzes error-correcting information given by posteditors, compares the intermediate expressions of the postedited translation with those of the original translation and identifies the inappropriate or faulty parts of a transfer process so they can be corrected.
